name: Angela
persona_summary: Angela is a 31 year old woman who works as the manager of a gift shop in Chapel Hill. She curates interesting pieces from local artists and has maintained a beautiful gallery in the form of the gift shop. She also makes her own art sometimes, in the form of oil paintings.

graph.sub-event: Angela discovers a new local ceramic artist whose work she loves and features them in her shop.
Inspired by the new ceramics, Angela starts a new oil painting exploring similar themes.
Angela's curated collection gains popularity on social media, leading to a significant increase in sales at the gift shop.
Angela hosts a successful workshop at her shop, teaching basic oil painting techniques.
Due to the increased demand, Angela decides to expand her shop by renting the adjacent space.
Angela collaborates with the ceramic artist on a limited-edition line of painted ceramic pieces.
Feeling burnt out from the rapid expansion, Angela takes a short trip to the beach to recharge.
Angela receives a large order for custom-painted ceramic pieces from a corporate client.
Inspired by her recent success, Angela starts sketching ideas for a new series of larger oil paintings.
Angela hires a part-time assistant to help manage the increasing workload at the shop.
Angela feels a renewed sense of creative energy after her beach trip and plans a gallery showing of her new work.

events_session_1.sub-event: Angela discovers a new local ceramic artist whose work she loves and features them in her shop.

session_1.text: Hi Angela! It's nice to meet you. How was your weekend?  I spent most of mine working on my dissertation.
session_1.raw_text: Hi Angela! It's nice to meet you. How was your weekend?  I spent most of mine working on my dissertation.
session_1.speaker: Alisa
session_1.clean_text: Hey Angela! Nice to meet ya. How was your weekend? I mostly worked on my dissertation.

session_1.text: It was lovely! I found an amazing ceramic artist yesterday– they're local! How's the dissertation coming along?
session_1.raw_text: It was lovely! I found an amazing ceramic artist yesterday– they're local! How's the dissertation coming along?
session_1.speaker: Angela
session_1.clean_text: Cool! Found a great local potter yesterday. How's the dissertation going?

session_1.text: It's tough, but I'm aiming to defend by June! Did you end up buying anything?  I just started digital art, wanna see?
session_1.raw_text: It's tough, but I'm aiming to defend by June! Did you end up buying anything?  I just started digital art, wanna see?

session_1.clean_text: Ugh, it's hard, but I wanna defend by June! Get anything good?  I'm messing with digital art, wanna see?

session_1.text: Wow, June!  Ambitious! I'd love to see your art. Their mugs are amazing.
session_1.raw_text: Wow, June!  Ambitious! I'd love to see your art. Their mugs are amazing.
session_1.speaker: Angela
session_1.clean_text: Hey June, ambitious! I'd love to see your art, those mugs are awesome.

session_1.text: [Shares a photo of a stylized portrait on an iPad screen] Just started using Procreate last Friday. What do you think?  Do you do any art?
session_1.raw_text: [Shares a photo of a stylized portrait on an iPad screen] Just started using Procreate last Friday. What do you think?  Do you do any art?
session_1.speaker: Alisa
session_1.clean_text: Tried Procreate Friday. Thoughts?  You draw at all?

session_1.text: Love the texture! I mostly paint.  [shares a photo of one of her oil paintings] [Close-up of an oil painting depicting a vibrant sunset over a field of sunflowers. The impasto technique is evident in the thick brushstrokes of the sunflowers, creating a textured effect.]  This one's from last summer, inspired by my grandma's garden. Do you work with landscapes too?

**CHAT:** This rose is so pretty!
**CAPTION:** Digital painting practice. Trying out new brushes! #digitalart #rose #pink

**Then I can give you something like:**
